intro: Calyptrostegia suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented rock cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Calyptrostegia suaveolens is notable for its aromatic foliage, which emits a pleasant, sweet scent when crushed.
